name: Harbour Hotel Galway

reviews.title: Avoid if you want to sleep!
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel recently and couldn't sleep because of the noise caused by rowdy guests. Staff didn't seem very concerned when I complained and when I asked for another room said none was available. I visit Galway regularly for work purposes (mostly at weekends) and I must say that noise in hotels is a big problem in general but was particularly bad in this hotel. Needless to say I won't be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is modern, classy and has a very cosy reception with a huge fire.The food in the restaurant was fantastic with great vegetarian options, although portions were slightly small. Bedroom was nicely decorated but was very warm and had to open window to a very noisy road beneath.Try to book a room at back of hotel away from road.The hotel is in a perfect location being only a 5 minute walk to galway city centre.I definitely recommend staying here
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel on bank holiday Monday and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is very modern and cleaned and maintained to an extremely high standard. The staff have to be the best that I have ever seen in Ireland and they couldn't do enough for us. The room we had was a corner room so was lovely and bright with a great view of the harbour. The bar was really cosy and the drinks and food very reasonably priced - in fact the drinks were cheaper here than some of
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the pubs around the city. The free parking was very convenient and it
reviews.title: 'It's far away I am today..'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was only a 5 minute walk to the city centre. The only thing that this
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.liked: — Great Location, Friendly Effiicient Service, Spotlessly Clean

reviews.text: This was our 2nd time here, having stayed here 4 years ago. 4 years ago it was perfectly present, this time not so great.
reviews.title: Noise at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were promised a non smoking room. When we opened the door of our non smoking room the stench of cigarettes was apalling. I immediately asked for a new room which to be fair they organised immediately. New room was fine, spacious and clean and thankfully odour free. One problem however was the apparent lack of hot water. Ours was tepid at best.
reviews.title: pretty good

likes.liked: — walking distance to the night life

reviews.text: The big problems were the fact that our room backed onto apartments and the car park.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: We barely slept a wink as revellers arrived home at all hours singing and shouting to the apartments at the back of the hotel. Now I know this isn't the hotels fault but it's hardly a selling point.
reviews.title: Will use again

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for car parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly the car park is not free. We were most surprised at this and whilst the fee wasn't much (the hotel discount the regular public rate) it left a sour taste in the mouth.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: I have stayed here several times as it the hotel by job uses when we are in Galway. After my (and other's) continuing complaints they have changed to a different hotel.
reviews.title: A pretty poor hotel.

reviews.text: The rooms at the front of the hotel are very noisy, you are woken up before 6 every morning large trucks coming off the docks. I heard several people complaining about this and each time the staff member acted surprised and said nobody had complained before.
reviews.title: Wonderful Friendly hotel

reviews.text: The rooms at the back of the hotel on the lower floors are very noisy if there is a function on in the hotel. Music can be heard very clearly in rooms up to the third floor.
reviews.title: Not at all bad
Below Average...
reviews.text: The rooms are basic and clean, not bad if you get a good rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the reception staff are quite friendly and helpful, with a few exceptions. I once left my bags in their storage room as my room wasn't ready when I arrived. When I came back later I was told the person who had the key had gone home and wouldn't be back till the next morning - not ideal.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and boyfriend stayed in the Harbour Hotel in Galway in Nov 2007 for the weekend. The rooms are small but nicely decorated. We ate in the hotel restaurant on our first night. It was expensive but very tasty! We also had a drink in the bar on Sat night and the bar man who served us was really friendly.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.liked: — The location was great and the hotel was nice and clean
likes.disliked: — Lights in bathroom were really artifical and bright - minor personal preference!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of hotel is great - 5 mins walk will bring you to Eyres Square or into the heart of the citys beautiful cobbled streets.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: This was our first time to Galway together and we really enjoyed it. There was a lovely laid back vibe in the city.
reviews.title: Good hotel

likes.disliked: — Be nice when they remove the oil tanks over the road but you don't see them unless you look

reviews.text: Salthill was gorgeous and we drove around Connemara up to Clifden which was really scenic.
reviews.title: Room good, food impartial
Not as good as it sounds
reviews.text: Great weekend!!

description: The Harbour Hotel Galway, is centrally located in the heart of Galway City - just a 3 minute walk to Eyre Square, Shop St. & Quay St. A family owned hotel, the focus is on customer service. Guests return to the Harbour Hotel, time and time again. Whilst the hotel is right in the heart of Galway City Centre, you will be able to enjoy a peaceful night’s sleep as the hotel is located at the historical port in a primarily residential area, removed from the roar of the famous Galway nightlife in full flow. With a range of double, twin, triple and family rooms available, The Harbour Hotel Galway is the perfect choice for a leisure break or a business trip.All of the guest bedrooms feature complimentary wireless internet access so you can work in comfort or keep in touch with loved ones at your leisure.A snapshot of our rooms:• Complimentary Wi-Fi (Wireless High Speed Internet)• Tea and coffee making facilities• Writing Desk• Cable TV• Trouser Press• Hairdryer• Bathroom amenities.Onsite parking is available to the rear of the hotel and free Wi-Fi throughout. The Harbour Seafood Bar & Grill.The Harbour Seafood Bar & Grill at the Harbour Hotel offers the very best of city centre dining in Galway. The perfect venue for a casual lunch or lingering romantic dinner. Head Chef Paddy Anslow's focus is on homemade, wholesome food using the very best of fresh, local produce. The ambiance is casual and you will feel instantly at ease on arrival. Recently renovated, with private booths and a warm, yet contemporary feel, the Harbour Seafood Bar & Grill is very popular with locals and residents alike. The Harbour Bar.Wind down at the Harbour Bar, the perfect place to chill out, catch up with friends and soak up the atmosphere. After a busy day, enjoy a glass of wine or a fun cocktail with friends. Watch up to the minute sports live on one of the two large Plasma Screens. Bar Menu served daily from 12noon until 10pm. Haven Health & Fitness allows you to work out in a personal environment at your own pace. Facilities of the gym include cardiovascular machines, weights and a stretching area. Conveniently located in the heart of Galway this small yet exclusive Fitness Club is designed with your modern busy lifestyle in mind.
